H0.text: which countries speak germanic languages. Germans

H1.text: which countries speak germanic languages. Swedes

H2.text: which countries speak germanic languages. Dutch

H3.text: which countries speak germanic languages. Danes

A4.text: German is a language of Austria, Belgium, Germany, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg and Switzerland; it also has regional status in Italy, Poland, Namibia and Denmark.

A5.text: Dutch is an official language of Aruba, Belgium, Curaçao, the Netherlands, Sint Maarten, and Suriname.

A6.text: German is the majority and official (or co‑official) language in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, and Liechtenstein.

A7.text: The North Germanic branch survives in modern Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Faroese, and Icelandic.
